item.title: Lycopene's Promising Result in Treating Breast Cancer
item.description: Lycopene has been found to have a promising result in treating breast cancer, not only prostate cancer as thought before. Researchers at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research have recently discovered that lycopene, a naturally occurring chemical found in red fruits and vegetables, has the potential to significantly inhibit the growth of breast cancer cells. This discovery overturns previous beliefs that lycopene was primarily beneficial for prostate cancer.
